WRITING.TEXT: I mean you can have reddit and not have an account, I know cause that #8217;s literally what Ive been doing

I mean everyone #8217;s calling you a jerk and maybe your comments were a little uncalled for, but they were still just words, the EP was the one who took it to a whole new level. So I #8217;m sorry you lost your scholarship

I have never agreed with someone more. My mom also bought me dresses and wanted me to do things with my hair, like curling and straightening(I eventually just cut it all off). I wanted to run and play in the mud and scream. Even now she gets mad at me cause I wear a sports bra 24/7 instead of the #8220;expensive #8221; normal ones she buys. If I #8217;m gonna start running I don #8217;t need to deal with that

It #8217;s absolutely insane, then she calls me weird for having a different opinion on clothing, or she freaks out if the sports bra strap peaks out a little bit, what is up with moms invading your under clothes

Hell yes, preach to the choir. I #8217;m only now starting to realize that a lot of the people I know are chock full of narcissistic tendencies, especially my mother and brother. My brother can be more judge mental even than my mother, when it comes to what I wear

Oh my god, my mom says the exact same thing to me and calls me weird when I say I #8217;m just more comfortable. Jokes on her, I found the perfect guy already, and he doesn #8217;t freaking care. He #8217;d just want to be comfortable if he did care at all

WRITING.TITLE: Parents Giving Me Bad Relationship Advice
WRITING.TEXT: Ok, first time posting ever, so if I do anything wrong let me know. I #8217;ve been a tomboy my whole life. I used to be really comfortable in my own skin, but my parents started telling me that my boyfriend wants a real lady, and that I need to change my personality or he #8217;ll break up with me. Also, they try to guilt trip me into wearing really girly clothes, and that is just not who I am. My boyfriend is a really nice guy, and I think we #8217;re doing well in our relationship. I have known him for 11 years, despite having only dated him for a year. We are both 18, and heading to the same college in the fall. Even though my bf hasn #8217;t said anything, should I still make an effort to be more #8220;lady like #8221;? I really love him, and I wouldn #8217;t want him to lose interest, but I also can #8217;t stand normal fancy or girly stuff. Is this just my parent making me doubt myself? What should I do? TL;DR: Parents say my boyfriend wants a girly girl, I am super confused
I do dress up nice when we go on dates, like I will put on a nice dress and makeup. I dress up when it counts, but to constantly tell me that he #8217;s gonna break up with me?
Yes, everything like I do something not particularly feminine, i get berated for being boyish, and they tell me guys don #8217;t like that
yeah he should #8217;ve known what he was getting into, and he #8217;s always been very very honest with me. I will ask him, thank you
Yeah ok, thank you, I should #8217;ve asked this sub for advice a long time ago.
I love it, it #8217;s just salty enough to fit my personality too. Thank you I #8217;m definitely gonna do it
Dang you right, thank you.
I know you #8217;re right, I #8217;m gonna ask him, And I #8217;m pretty sure it #8217;s just my parents being narcissists and trying to control me, thank you
Damn, you #8217;re right, I know you #8217;re right. I guess I get flustered over nothing
Good to know my mom is lying when she says that all married women are super feminine
Oh the eloping, I mentioned it once and she threatened to disown me, I guess we #8217;ll see about that one when the time comes, but the thought of a dress like that makes me cringe

Man I feel you, I had a short pixie for 3 years, ( just now growing it out cause I got bored), and I typically wear pretty baggy clothes, despite having a fairly feminine figure. People would always call me out on my sexuality and whether I wanted to look like a boy or not. Also have a very Christian family, and my brother is somewhat sexist. I #8217;m a tomboy, like, get over yourselves . So yeah, I feel you 290%, and i day do whatever you want, it #8217;s your hair

Yeah, I mean I have stretch marks on the outsides of my thighs. I got them when I started really working out and noticed my quads visibly getting bigger and more muscular. I also gained some when I hit my biggest growth spurt (of at least 4 inches), at 15

Yes I hate them too! Although it sort of depends, if I #8217;m home with my parents I #8217;m barely breathing because I want to be able to hear whatever they #8217;re doing. I was cutting some paper once and didn #8217;t realize my mom was home. She yelled my name from down the hall, and was far too close for how loud she yelled. It scared me so bad that the knife slipped and I ended up slicing into my thumb. When I #8217;m with friends though, as long as it #8217;s not right next to me I #8217;m usually fine
Literally though, I #8217;m a Christian and love that show. Supernatural too, also Lucifer. What the hell guys? You #8217;re giving me a bad name here
Chucky, I think I #8217;m in love with you Game
Please do. I #8217;d love to be ended

Ok, but they can #8217;t even talk about this. I have a dislocated rib right now, going to the chiropractor tomorrow, and it #8217;s been out for three months. Do you even know how freaking painful it is to do an workouts when your rib is poking your lung? If your rib fell out during sex, you would not continue
From what I saw of the picture in my recommended (just your chin) you look 112 not just 12
I reached sexual maturity by age 10 then, lovely
At first I saw this and was about to get mad, cause that #8217;s my body type just a little less flat in the stomach area. Then I saw the mailbox head and realized I was an idiot
Oh shoot, I have a stutter when I #8217;m talking to my mom specifically. My nmom
My mom made me do school doing the summer, my fault for being homeschooled, but I got ahead for college so not terrible i guess
Even from a creationist standpoint, that #8217;s 100% false
If I had this I wouldn #8217;t have to go alone
That, is absolutely perfect, and also super inspiring, I wanna draw now
I got out markers, but they #8217;re just as good, thanks for the enthusiasm
Haha, hahaha, dang, I thought if I laughed enough I would be able to have another pun, but I guess I #8217;m not sharp enough
You should go for it! I believe in you, and yeah the lighting and the mood and the colors are all gorgeous
I #8217;ve been experimenting with this thing called zentangle, it #8217;s fairly interesting
I also wear sports bras all the time, they #8217;re way more comfy

Yes, my mom always calls me weird for wearing sports bras and that I #8217;m the only one who wears them all the time, jokes on her Reddit #8217;s got my back. Also, that #8217;s weird that that pads won #8217;t unfold, I usually just take them out, unfold them, and they #8217;re good

Mmm, yeah I get it, it can be fairly hard, I usually roll them up and they unfold as they slide all the way back in and then situate them through the outside fabric, but there have been a few I #8217;ve been unable to fix, so totally understandable.
I wish I could thumb up your comment more times than just once, but unfortunately I can #8217;t.
Well I agree with 100%, I may be biased since I #8217;m going into law enforcement, but I #8217;ve interviewed and done a lot of reading to back up my opinion, so don #8217;t hide your opinion
Oh don #8217;t worry, calling BS is the thing I #8217;m the best at, and thank you
If this is about how they parked, taking up a ton of spaces, they have to do that, but if it #8217;s about the type of truck then I #8217;m still confused

WRITING.TITLE: Can I get some serious advice about law enforcement?
WRITING.TEXT: EDIT: I #8217;ve been made aware that I got some firearm terminology incorrect by a nice person in the comment section. I #8217;m not going to change it where I #8217;ve typed it, but I know it #8217;s wrong. Hi there, I #8217;m a 18F, going to college in a month to study criminology, and after that I plan to go to police academy and serve in a specific city in a mid western state in the US. I #8217;ve interviewed two cops, taken a criminology course from a Seargent, and I #8217;ve gone on a 4 hour ride along. I also have a fairly tough workout regimen, but it could probably do with some updates to make it harder. I #8217;ve also learned how to shoot 4 different guns, 9mils, 22mils, 45mils, and an AR-15. Can I get some advice on anything else I can do to be ready for my career? I would appreciate it very much.

Oh ok, thank you, I was using the terminology my dad used when he taught me to shoot, and I didn #8217;t think to double check. Thanks for the advice, I #8217;m sure I #8217;ll learn more when I get to police academy as well.
Ok, thanks, that should come in handy.

Thank you, but I do have to ask, I have been recommended this major from people I have asked. Some cousins of mine work in law enforcement, and some officers I #8217;ve interviewed say criminal justice or psychology. Is it really useless and I #8217;ve just gotten bad advice?

Thank you, this is the biggest advice I #8217;ve gotten from people I #8217;ve asked face to face, and it does help to have it ingrained. As of yet, I #8217;ve never even gotten a traffic ticket, and the only time I #8217;ve even been questioned by police was when I was in an accident that was he other persons fault (they hit me while I was stopped at a stop sign). Thank you so much!
Well thank you then! And thank you for what you do
Thank you for the kind words! And yeah they probably will train me, but I #8217;m happy to know I #8217;ve gotten it wrong now

Hi, I #8217;m not op, but I was scrolling through the advice and stopped on yours. It #8217;s the only one if it #8217;s kind in the comments, and I wanted to say thank you for bringing God into it. Most people would probably scoff, but he really is the answer, so thank you
Oh, good to know, paperwork is the aspect I keep forgetting about. Thank you, I #8217;ll look that up immediately
Got it, I am planning on using a minor as a fall back, i just haven #8217;t decided yet what it #8217;s going to be, so thank you for the insight
Thank you, with the shooting, I just wanted to get a feel for a fun itself, so I won #8217;t try to learn anything else then. Thank you so much
Pfft, haha, I am glad I was corrected, somebody(my dad) taught me the wrong terminology
Got it, I am planning on using a minor as a fall back, i just haven #8217;t decided yet what it #8217;s going to be, so thank you for the insight
Gotcha, I would like to continue in the field of law enforcement even if the cop thing fails, and I #8217;m using a minor as a backup. Thank you so much!
Thank you! I appreciate your help so much!
Interesting advice, might consider it, thanks
Thank you, that #8217;s good advice

Thank you! I #8217;ve been active, with a fairly consistent musculature for most my life. I #8217;m actually worried now though since I #8217;m going to college, that my workout won #8217;t be as consistent, so if you have any specific workouts you #8217;d recommend, if be super grateful, thanks!
Yeah yeah, I know I know, I screwed up terminology, that #8217;s why I made the edit
Well thank you, I hope I can help others the same way you were helped
Ok thank you! I appreciate it very much, and I hope to be able to serve to the best of my ability no matter what others think
Don #8217;t become a police officer?
You are seriously a god send, thank you so much. This is all fantastic advice, and it will come in handy
Well as a girl who grew up with two parents, I was actually closer to my dad. I may have grown up slightly unfeminine, and slightly violent, but I am still perfectly fine and not rude, so suck it MIL
Oh good to know, thank you

WRITING.TITLE: I Was Stupid as Usual, and Screwed Up
WRITING.TEXT: First time posting on the sub, on mobile, all that stuff. I need help. 2 nights ago I was feeling lower than usual and cut semi deep vertical lines into the tops of my thighs. Usually this wouldn #8217;t be a problem, I have scars like that on my arms and thighs and hips already. My mom just told me that we #8217;re going to a water amusement park in a week and a half. I always wear shorts anyway, but if they move at all while I #8217;m on a ride everyone #8217;s going to notice. The people I #8217;m going with have no clue that I intentionally cut, and while I can make excuses about the scars and the occasional mark, these are too obvious. Does anyone know a way to make things like that heal faster, or something I can use to semi cover it or anything? My mom will kill me if she knows about my issues.
